parameters.subject: =Hi, {{ $('email lowercase').item.json.body.data.conversation_initiation_client_data.dynamic_variables.first_name }} here is the summary of our conversation
parameters.bodyContent:
=

Hi

Here’s your meeting summary based on the conversation with Leonard:

{{ $json.matter.heading }}
D1 Name of client – this will be publishable. If you cannot reveal the client’s name, give a general description.
{{ $json.matter.D1.client_name }}
D2 Summary of matter and your department's role – Please say why this matter was important. Also, tell us exactly what role your department played.
{{ $json.matter.D2.formatted_output }}
D3 Matter value – include currency and amount in figures
{{ $json.matter.D3.formatted_output }}
D4 Is this a cross-border matter? If yes, please indicate the jurisdictions involved.
{{ $json.matter.D4.formatted_output }}
D5 Lead lawyer
{{ $json.matter.D5.formatted_output }}
D6 Other team members
{{ $json.matter.D6.formatted_output }}
D7 Other firms advising on the matter and their role(s)
{{ $json.matter.D7.formatted_output }}
D8 Date of completion or current status
{{ $json.matter.D8.formatted_output }}
D9 Other information about this matter – e.g. link to press coverage
{{ $json.matter.D9.formatted_output }}

That’s everything for now — hope it was helpful. If you’d like to log another matter straight away, you can do it here.

– Leonard

transcript.message: Hey Lee, how are you doing today? Ready to see how to become a matter submission maestro?
Yeah.
Great, it should take about 5 minutes to document a new matter for your Chambers submission?
Okay.
Let's start with confidentiality. Is this matter confidential, or can it be published?
It can be published.
Thanks. Could you please tell me the name of the client?
Winter Wonderland.
Got it. And what is the high-level description of this matter?
So Winter Wonderland sticker book bought Usborne Activities which is one of their key competitors.
That sounds like a significant transaction. What specific role did your department play in this matter?
So we acted on the full transaction from due diligence through to SPA negotiation and some quite thorny employment issues.
That sounds like complex work. Now, focusing on the previous twelve months, could you describe the specific work your department did on this matter?
Yeah it was all done within the last 12 months.
Thanks. And why was this matter particularly important to Winter Wonderland, your firm, or the wider legal market?
It was quite a significant acquisition. It was going to improve market share for Winter Wonderland.

Let me make sure I've captured this correctly. Your department played a key role in the acquisition of Usborne Activities by Winter Wonderland, handling everything from due diligence to SPA negotiation and employment issues. This was a significant acquisition aimed at increasing Winter Wonderland's market share, and all this work was completed within the last twelve months. Does that sound right?
Yeah.
What was the value or deal size of this matter? Please include the currency.
180 million rinky-dinkies.
I see the deal size is one hundred and eighty million. Could you please clarify the currency for me?
US dollars.
Thanks. So that's US dollars one hundred and eighty million. Is this a cross-border matter involving multiple jurisdictions?
No, UK only.
Understood. And who was the lead lawyer on this matter?
I was...
Great. And which office are you based in?
Bradford.
Thanks. And what practice group do you belong to?
Tax...
I see. Were there any other team members from your firm involved in this matter?
Yep, there was a lad called Toby Curtis...
I can help with that. What office is Toby based in, and what practice group does he belong to?
So he's in the employment practice and he's based in Manchester.
Thanks. Anyone else from your team?
No.
Okay. Were there any other law firms involved in this matter?
No.
And when did work start on this matter?
February.
Could you provide that date in day, month, year format?
February this year.
So that would be February twenty twenty-five. Has this matter been completed, or is it still ongoing?
It's completed.
And when was it completed?
November. November
So that would be November twenty twenty-five. As this matter is confidential, I assume there is no press coverage?
. Correct
Is there any additional information to enhance this matter submission that hasn't been discussed yet?
No.
Thank you! I've captured all the information for your matter submission. You should receive an email summary shortly. Is there anything you'd like to clarify or change?
No thank you.
Perfect. Your submission is complete. Have a great day!

D3_matter_value.rationale: The user specified the matter value as "180 million rinky-dinkies" and after the agent asked for clarification on the currency, the user specified "US dollars". Therefore, the matter value is "USD 180 million".

json_schema.description: If applicable, provide a list of other team members containing names, office and practice group. Follow a list format: "John Doe (London, M&A), Sarah Johnson (Manchester, Finance)".

json_schema.description: Ask the user if the matter is confidential or not. Confidential = TRUE, not confidential = FALSE.

D0_confidential.rationale: The agent asks 'Is this matter confidential, or can it be published?' and the user responds 'It can be published.'. Therefore, the matter is not confidential, so the value is FALSE.

json_schema.description: Date of the matter completion or closing if not ongoing.

D8_end_date.rationale: The user confirms that the matter was completed in November 2025. Therefore, the date of matter completion is November 2025.

json_schema.description: Capture any other information about the matter that is not covered in the other variables.

json_schema.description:
TRUE if the matter has been completed or closed.
FALSE if the matter is still ongoing.

D2_why_important.value: It was quite a significant acquisition. It was going to improve market share for Winter Wonderland.

json_schema.description: A description of why the matter and/or the work for this matter is important to the client, the law firm that employs the user and the broader importance of the matter for the legal industry and the type of client that they helped. Was it  a precedent setting matter?

D2_why_important.rationale: The user at 2025-11-30T21:12:03+00:00 states that the matter was important because "It was quite a significant acquisition. It was going to improve market share for Winter Wonderland."

json_schema.description: Practice group of the lead lawyer.

D5_lead_lawyer_practice_group.rationale: The user states that they belong to the 'Tax' practice group at 2025-11-30T21:13:15+00:00.

This was a significant acquisition aimed at increasing Winter Wonderland's market share, and all this work was completed within the last twelve months.

json_schema.description: First sentence: What work you've done in the past 12 months. Rest: Context about matter/client and why important. Keep succinct (one paragraph).

D2_formatted_output.rationale: The agent summarized the work done in the past 12 months, the context of the matter, and its importance to the client. The summary is: "Your department played a key role in the acquisition of Usborne Activities by Winter Wonderland, handling everything from due diligence to SPA negotiation and employment issues. This was a significant acquisition aimed at increasing Winter Wonderland's market share, and all this work was completed within the last twelve months."

analysis.transcript_summary: Lee provided information to the agent about a matter for a Chambers submission. The matter involved Winter Wonderland's acquisition of Usborne Activities, with Lee's department handling due diligence, SPA negotiation, and employment issues. The deal size was $180 million USD, UK only, led by Lee in Bradford Tax, with Toby Curtis (Manchester, Employment) also involved. Work started in February 2025 and completed in November 2025. The matter can be published.

transcript.message: Hey Lee, how are you doing today? Ready to see how to become a matter submission maestro?
Definitely.

Great, it should take about 5 minutes to document a new matter for your Chambers submission?
As the matter is confidential or can it be published?
It can be published.
Great, and who is the client on this matter?
Wetherspoons...
Thanks, Lee. Could you spell that for me?
W-E-T-H-E-R-S-P-O-O-N-S

Got it, Wetherspoons.

Now, could you give me a high-level description of the matter?
Yep, so we advised Wetherspoons on their acquisition of five strategic retail pub sites in and around Waterloo station.
That sounds like a significant undertaking. What specific role did your department play in this acquisition?

So it was a combined departmental role, so between the corporate team who did the transaction docs from multiple sellers, there were also quite a number of property related issues regarding dilapidations, claims, fit out contracts, so from a commercial perspective, etc. and some planning to extend one of the sites which involve quite a lot of negotiation with Transport for London because it impacted some of the tube lines at Waterloo.

That sounds like complex work with multiple facets.

To align with the submission requirements, could you describe the specific work done on this matter in the previous twelve months?

Yeah, so we started advising Wetherspoons in November 2023, but in the last 12 months we have been negotiating the commercial contracts to closure and also submitting various different planning applications.
Thanks, Lee. And why was this matter particularly important to Wetherspoons, your firm, or the wider legal market?
Um...
That's okay...
transcript.original_message:
That's okay. We can leave that field blank for now or you can provide it later.

Let me make sure I've captured this correctly. You advised Wetherspoons on the acquisition of five strategic retail pub sites near Waterloo station. Your department handled the transaction documents, property issues such as dilapidations and claims, fit-out contracts, and planning applications, including negotiations with Transport for London due to the impact on tube lines.

transcript.message: The sites were deemed as significant to Wetherspoons because they are prime London real estate. So we're trying to get the deals done as quickly as possible and get the sites operational.

Let me make sure I've captured this correctly. Your department advised Wetherspoons on the acquisition of five strategic retail pub sites near Waterloo station. The work done in the previous twelve months involved negotiating the commercial contracts to closure and submitting various planning applications, with the goal of getting the sites operational quickly due to their prime London location. This was important for Wetherspoons as these sites represent valuable real estate in a key area. Does that sound right?
Yep, sounds good.
Great. What was the value or deal size of this matter? Please include the currency.
Combined it was £120 million.
Okay, so that's £120 million. Is that correct?
Yes.
This sounds like a cross-border matter involving multiple jurisdictions. Is that correct?
No.
Understood. And which single jurisdiction was this matter in?
The UK.

Okay, domestic matter in the UK.

Who was the lead lawyer on this matter?
Myself, Lee Curtis.
Great. And which office are you based in?
London.
And what practice group do you belong to?
Corporate.

Thanks, Lee.

Were there any other team members from your firm involved in this matter?
Yep, I'm just going to type him into the chat.
No problem, I'll wait for you to add them.
Lynda Nazer - planning
Thanks. And what office is Lynda based in, and what's her practice group?
Andy Batty
Thanks, Andy. Could you confirm his office and practice group?
Sam Stamp
Thanks, Sam. Could you confirm his office and practice group?
So Linda's in the London office, Andy is a specialist tax lawyer based in Manchester and Sam is an employment partner based in Bristol.

Thanks, Lee. So we have Lynda Nazer (London, Planning), Andy Batty (Manchester, Tax), and Sam Stamp (Bristol, Employment).

Were there any other team members from your firm involved in this matter?
No
Okay. And were there any other law firms involved in this matter?

Cliffrod Chance - acting for two of the sellers
Gowling - acting for a seller
Yeah

Thanks. So that's Clifford Chance acting for two of the sellers, and Gowling acting for another seller.

Any other firms involved?
No
Okay. When did work start on this matter?
November 23

Thanks. So that's November 2023.

Has this matter been completed, or is it still ongoing?
It's ongoing

Okay, ongoing since November 2023.

And is there any additional information to enhance this matter submission that hasn't been discussed yet?
There's quite a bit of press about it
Can you provide details of any press coverage for this matter, such as publication names or...
transcript.original_message: Can you provide details of any press coverage for this matter, such as publication names or URLs?

transcript.message: https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/ckgn0w129lqo
Thanks! Any other press coverage?
No
Thank you! I've captured all the information for your matter submission. You should receive an email summary shortly. Is there anything you'd like to clarify or change?
No thanks
Perfect. Your submission is complete. Have a great day!

analysis.transcript_summary: Lee provided information to the agent for a Chambers submission regarding Wetherspoons' acquisition of five retail pub sites near Waterloo station for £120 million. The work, ongoing since Nov 2023, involved commercial contracts and planning applications. Other firms involved were Clifford Chance and Gowling. The team included Lynda Nazer (Planning), Andy Batty (Tax), and Sam Stamp (Employment). The matter has press coverage, including a BBC article.
